summary: "Digital twins" are virtual representations of physical objects, processes, or systems—like factories, traffic patterns, and even people. A digital twin is used to predict how changes may affect its physical counterpart. For example, a city could use a digital twin to monitor its energy use to plan for extreme weather. Digital twins have benefits, like making manufacturing more efficient, but they can raise technical, security...
title: Science & Tech Spotlight: Digital Twins—Virtual Models of People and Objects
